name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is a town on the southeast coast of Bangladesh. It's known for its very long, sandy beachfront, stretching from Cox's Bazar town to the south along the Bay of Bengal. The beach is backed by a dense seafront line of hotels, shops, and eateries. South of town, the tropical rainforest of Himchari National Park has waterfalls and many birds. North, sea turtles breed on nearby Sonadia Island.

name: Sreemangal
description: Sreemangal is a town in northeastern Bangladesh, known for its vast tea gardens. It's surrounded by hills covered with tea gardens, and is an excellent spot for nature lovers. The area is famous for its numerous tea estates, pineapple gardens, and the Lawachara National Park, home to many rare species of birds and animals, including the endangered hoolock gibbons.

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans is a vast mangrove forest on the coast of the Bay of Bengal. It's one of the largest such forests in the world and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Sundarbans is known for its rich biodiversity, including the Bengal tiger, as well as numerous bird species, crocodiles, and other wildlife. It's a popular destination for wildlife enthusiasts and eco-tourists.
